reporting-org.narrative: Bundesministerium für wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung (BMZ)
Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

title.narrative: Support of the quality infrastructure in Serbia

description.narrative: Als EU-Beitrittskandidat hat Serbien mit der Durchführung wichtiger Schritte zur Umsetzung des gemeinschaftlichen Besitzstandes der EU (Acquis Communautaire) begonnen. Hierzu zählt auch die Schaffung entsprechender EU konformer Strukturen im Bereich der Qualitätsinfrastruktur (QI). QI basiert auf einer Reihe von Komponenten, (Normung, Messwesen, Konformitätsbewertung, Akkreditierung) welche eng miteinander verbunden sind, ein Netzwerk bilden und deren logische Verknüpfungen eine fachliche Hierarchie zu Grunde liegt. Dieses nationale Netzwerk muss sich an internationalen Vorgaben orientieren. Ziel der serbischen Projektpartner ist es, zeitgerecht für den EU-Beitritt, das gesetzliche Regelwerk im Bereich Qualitätsinfrastruktur in nationales Recht zu transformieren und die erforderliche Infrastruktur zur Umsetzung der Gesetze und Richtlinien in diesem Bereich aufzubauen bzw. die alten Strukturen zu reformieren. Es ist der ausdrückliche Wunsch des politischen Partners, in diesen Prozess die PTB weiterhin als kompetente Durchführungsorganisation einzubinden. Das Dienstleistungsangebot der serbischen QI ist nach wie vor nur eingeschränkt in der Lage, die Ziele der Handelsförderung und des Verbraucher-, Umwelt- und Arbeitsschutzes so abzudecken, dass diese international anerkannt werden. Das Kernproblem lautet: Die serbischen Institutionen sind ohne weitere Unterstützung nicht in der Lage, die Anforderungen des Acquis Communautaire in Bezug auf QI zeitgerecht zu erfüllen.

As a candidate for EU membership, Serbia has started to take important steps to implement the EU acquis communautaire. This also includes the creation of appropriate EU-compliant structures in the area of ??quality infrastructure (QI). QI is based on a number of components (standardization, metrology, conformity assessment, accreditation) which are closely linked to one another, form a network and whose logical links are based on a technical hierarchy. This national network must be based on international guidelines. The aim of the Serbian project partners is to transform the legal framework in the area of ??quality infrastructure into national law in good time for EU accession and to build up the necessary infrastructure for the implementation of the laws and guidelines in this area or to reform the old structures. It is the express wish of the political partner to continue to involve PTB as a competent implementing organization in this process. The range of services offered by the Serbian QI is still only able to cover the goals of trade promotion and consumer, environmental and occupational safety in such a way that these are internationally recognized. The core problem is: Without further support, the Serbian institutions are not in a position to meet the requirements of the Acquis Communautaire with regard to QI in a timely manner.

As a candidate for EU membership, Serbia has started to take important steps to implement the EU acquis communautaire. This also includes the creation of appropriate EU-compliant structures in the area of ??quality infrastructure (QI). QI is based on a number of components (standardization, metrology, conformity assessment, accreditation) which are closely linked to one another, form a network and whose logical links are based on a technical hierarchy. This national network must be based on international guidelines. The aim of the Serbian project partners is to transform the legal framework in the area of ??quality infrastructure into national law in good time for EU accession and to build up the necessary infrastructure for the implementation of the laws and guidelines in this area or to reform the old structures. It is the express wish of the political partner to continue to involve PTB as a competent implementing organization in this process. The range of services offered by the Serbian QI is still only able to cover the goals of trade promotion and consumer, environmental and occupational safety in such a way that these are internationally recognized. The core problem is: Without further support, the Serbian institutions are not in a position to meet the requirements of the Acquis Communautaire with regard to QI in a timely manner.
Die Qualitätsinfrastruktur Serbiens hat (in den Bereichen Metrologie und Akkreditierung) bedeutende Fortschritte hinsichtlich der Umsetzung des Acquis Communautaire gemacht.
